attributes.action: Accept the opinion of the public majority as priority for the future of Britain
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It seems strange to me that my region of this country had a
     referendum on the congestion charge to improve public transport
     (Greater Manchester)

     I think this referendum would have been legitimate if the
     opinion of the public majority mattered anyway. Such a tiny
     thing does get votes but when it comes to things like...

     The war in Iraq and Afghanistan, the Lisbon treaty, the
     European Union and even who our actual prime minister is!! 
     These things are not important enough for the public majority
     but a simple congestion charge is?

     Prime minister. LISTEN TO THE PUBLIC MAJORITY!

rejection.details: Your title should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
